task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and target outline, align the circular end-effector, execute several leftward pushes to move the block into the target outline, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base robot with a circular blue end-effector must push a red T-shaped block across a white table into a T-shaped target outline drawn on the surface. The robot first detects both the block and the target, approaches the block, aligns its tool yaw for planar pushing, and executes a series of short pushes in a consistent direction. After progress, it verifies alignment against the target outline and finally retreats to a safe height. Control and observation are discrete (10 Hz), so actions use modest timeouts and repeated pushes to accumulate motion.
preconditions: Workspace clear and block visible in camera view
Target outline reachable on the table plane
Friction sufficient for pushing without slipping
stepwise_plan: Move above and approach/align to the block.
Repeat short leftward pushes to translate the block.
success_criteria: The T-block lies within the target outline boundaries.
No collisions with environment other than controlled contact.
Robot retreats to a safe standoff pose.
failure_and_recovery: If push slips or under-moves: repeat push cycles.
If misalignment occurs: re-approach and realign before continuing.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is aligned with the target outline and the robot has executed the retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect the T-shaped target outline on the table.
Move above the block with a small vertical offset.
Planar approach to make controlled pushing contact.
Orient the tool yaw for lateral pushing.
Execute a short push to translate the block leftward.
Align and verify block position relative to the target.
Back away to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Perception misses block or target due to glare/occlusion
Collision with table fixtures or arm self-collision limits
recovery_strategy: Retry perception with decorator until success
Re-approach and re-align before additional pushes
Use repeated short pushes instead of one long push
Retreat and re-detect if large pose error occurs
assumptions: Frames show a blue outline target while the instruction says green; we follow the frames.
Camera frame defines direction_deg=180 as leftward relative motion.
End-effector yaw at 90° is adequate for planar pushing contact.

expected_success_criteria: Block centroid and orientation align with target outline within ~1–2 cm / 2°
